intro: Anemonospermos diffusa, commonly known as the diffused anemonospermos, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other similar species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, white to pale yellow flowers with numerous stamens and a central pistil. Its leaves are typically palmately divided, with a soft, hairy texture. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
